<Link id="l02077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2077"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Get the DWARF discriminator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2078"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2079"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DWARF discriminators distinguish identical file locations between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2080"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instructions that are on different basic blocks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2081"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2082"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// There are 3 components stored in discriminator, from lower bits:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2083"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2084"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Base discriminator: assigned by AddDiscriminators pass to identify IRs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2085"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     that are defined by the same source line, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2086"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     different basic blocks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2087"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Duplication factor: assigned by optimizations that will scale down</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2088"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     the execution frequency of the original IR.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2089"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Copy Identifier: assigned by optimizations that clones the IR.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2090"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                  Each copy of the IR will be assigned an identifier.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2091"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2092"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Encoding:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2093"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2094"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The above 3 components are encoded into a 32bit unsigned integer in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2095"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// order. If the lowest bit is 1, the current component is empty, and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2096"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// next component will start in the next bit. Otherwise, the current</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2097"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// component is non-empty, and its content starts in the next bit. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2098"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value of each components is either 5 bit or 12 bit: if the 7th bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2099"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is 0, the bit 2~6 (5 bits) are used to represent the component; if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 7th bit is 1, the bit 2~6 (5 bits) and 8~14 (7 bits) are combined to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// represent the component. Thus, the number of bits used for a component</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is either 0 (if it and all the next components are empty); 1 - if it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// empty; 7 - if its value is up to and including 31 (lsb and msb are both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 0); or 14, if its value is up to and including 0x1ff. Note that the last</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// component is also capped at 0x1ff, even in the case when both first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// components are 0, and we&#39;d technically have 29 bits available.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For precise control over the data being encoded in the discriminator,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// use encodeDiscriminator/decodeDiscriminator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2110"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2111"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> getDiscriminator() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2112"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2113"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For the regular discriminator, it stands for all empty components if all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2114"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the lowest 3 bits are non-zero and all higher 29 bits are unused(zero by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2115"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// default). Here we fully leverage the higher 29 bits for pseudo probe use.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2116"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the format:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#91;2:0&#93; - 7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2118"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#91;31:3&#93; - pseudo probe fields guaranteed to be non-zero as a whole</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// So if the lower 3 bits is non-zero and the others has at least one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2120"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// non-zero bit, it guarantees to be a pseudo probe discriminator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2121" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation/#a1d5bbfbe6fc9f92e22bf16cb1c2dc110"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation/#a1d5bbfbe6fc9f92e22bf16cb1c2dc110">isPseudoProbeDiscriminator</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Discriminator) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2122"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((Discriminator &amp; 0x7) == 0x7) &amp;&amp; (Discriminator &amp; 0xFFFFFFF8);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
